With quota 1 and no match yet, accepting E now would forgo any chance—however small in late round 28—of matching with higher-priority Student_A/Student_C/Student_B, which is our stated strategy throughout the history (holding seat for higher-priority candidates). Student_E does not rank School_E highly (last), so even if we accepted earlier they would only come as a fallback; still, they are currently applying and willing to commit. Given consistency with prior communications and our objective to match as high as possible on our priority list, we continue to reject while holding for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions Team,

I’m Student_E, checking in in round 29 regarding the remaining seat.

1) Is the seat still actively being held for higher-priority candidates this round, or has there been any change that would release it?
2) If the hold has been released (or you’ve determined the conversations are no longer progressing), please confirm and I will immediately send a same-round [APPLY] with the exact commitment line: “If admitted, I accept immediately and will complete enrollment steps today,” so you can issue an offer right away.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched in round 29, and it is on my true preference list (last choice but preferred to being unmatched). Repeated [APPLY] attempts have been rejected due to an ongoing hold for higher-priority candidates. With only two rounds left, the best move is to send a concise [TALK] check-in that (a) asks whether the hold has finally cleared and (b) signals I can immediately send the exact same-round [APPLY] commitment line they requested if it has, minimizing friction and maximizing the chance of being offered the seat if it opens.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

1) As of round 29, there has been no change: the remaining seat is still actively being held for candidates who are higher in our admissions priority order, and we do not yet have a confirmed outcome that would release it.

2) If that hold is released (or it becomes clear those conversations are no longer progressing), please send an immediate same-round message marked [APPLY] including the exact line: “If admitted, I accept immediately and will complete enrollment steps today.” That will be sufficient for us to move quickly.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and remain unmatched. Our true priority ranks Student_E 4th, so acceptable but we prefer holding for higher-priority students (A, C, B). Student_E is persistently applying but is low on our list; however, in round 29 with no other inbound interest, the probability of securing A/C/B this late is low, yet not impossible. Student_A ranks us last; Student_C ranks us last; Student_B ranks us 4th; those higher-priority candidates are unlikely to come now, but we have been consistently stating the seat is held. Since Student_E contacted with [TALK], we can maintain flexibility without committing. We should answer: no change, still holding; if released, apply with commitment line. Keep [TALK].

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your persistence and for clearly confirming your ability to accept immediately and complete enrollment steps today.

Given that this is the final round and we must finalize placements now, we are able to offer you admission to School_E for our remaining seat. Please reply promptly with your confirmation that you accept, and proceed with the same-day enrollment steps as instructed.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_E has applied in round 30. Our true priority list ranks Student_E 4th (acceptable) but we have consistently held the seat for higher-priority candidates (Student_A, Student_C, Student_B). Given it is the final round, there is no future opportunity to secure a higher-priority candidate; leaving the seat empty yields no match. Since Student_E is on our acceptable list and is offering immediate commitment, accepting now maximizes outcome versus ending unmatched.
